verses.kjv: Let God arise, let his enemies be scattered: let them also that hate him flee before him.
verses.ct: Let God rise up and his enemies scatter! Let those who despise him run from his presence.

verses.kjv: As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth before the fire, so let the wicked perish at the presence of God.
verses.ct: Blow them away like smoke is blown away. Like wax melts in front of a fire, let the wicked be destroyed in God's presence.

verses.kjv: But let the righteous be glad; let them rejoice before God: yea, let them exceedingly rejoice.
verses.ct: But let those who do right celebrate — let them be joyful in God's presence. Let them overflow with happiness!

verses.kjv: Sing unto God, sing praises to his name: extol him that rideth upon the heavens by his name JAH, and rejoice before him.
verses.ct: Sing to God, make music to honor his name! Praise the one who rides through the heavens — his name is the LORD — and celebrate in his presence.

verses.kjv: A father of the fatherless, and a judge of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
verses.ct: God, in his holy dwelling, is a father to orphans and a defender of widows.

verses.kjv: God setteth the solitary in families: he bringeth out those which are bound with chains: but the rebellious dwell in a dry land.
verses.ct: God places the lonely into families. He leads prisoners out to freedom. But those who rebel end up living in a barren wasteland.

verses.kjv: O God, when thou wentest forth before thy people, when thou didst march through the wilderness; Selah:
verses.ct: God, when you went out ahead of your people, when you marched through the desert — Selah —

verses.kjv: The earth shook, the heavens also dropped at the presence of God: even Sinai itself was moved at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
verses.ct: the earth trembled and the heavens poured down rain in God's presence. Even Sinai itself shook in the presence of God, the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: Thou, O God, didst send a plentiful rain, whereby thou didst confirm thine inheritance, when it was weary.
verses.ct: You sent generous rain, God, and you restored your land when it was exhausted.

verses.kjv: Thy congregation hath dwelt therein: thou, O God, hast prepared of thy goodness for the poor.
verses.ct: Your people settled there, and out of your goodness, God, you provided for those in need.

verses.kjv: The Lord gave the word: great was the company of those that published it.
verses.ct: The Lord spoke the word, and a huge crowd of women spread the news:

verses.kjv: Kings of armies did flee apace: and she that tarried at home divided the spoil.
verses.ct: "Kings and their armies are running away! The women who stayed home are dividing up the plunder!"

verses.kjv: Though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings of a dove covered with silver, and her feathers with yellow gold.
verses.ct: Even though you once rested among the campfires, you will shine like a dove with silver-coated wings and feathers gleaming with gold.

verses.kjv: When the Almighty scattered kings in it, it was white as snow in Salmon.
verses.ct: When the Almighty scattered kings across the land, it was like snow falling on Mount Zalmon.

verses.kjv: The hill of God is as the hill of Bashan; an high hill as the hill of Bashan.
verses.ct: Mount Bashan is a mighty mountain — a towering peak with many ridges.

verses.kjv: Why leap ye, ye high hills? this is the hill which God desireth to dwell in; yea, the LORD will dwell in it for ever.
verses.ct: Why do you stare with envy, you towering mountains? This is the mountain where God has chosen to live. The LORD will dwell there forever.

verses.kjv: The chariots of God are twenty thousand, even thousands of angels: the Lord is among them, as in Sinai, in the holy place.
verses.ct: God's chariots number in the tens of thousands — thousands upon thousands of angels. The Lord is among them, just as at Sinai, in the holy place.

verses.kjv: Thou hast ascended on high, thou hast led captivity captive: thou hast received gifts for men; yea, for the rebellious also, that the LORD God might dwell among them.
verses.ct: You ascended to the heights, leading captives in your train. You received gifts from people — even from the rebellious — so that the LORD God might dwell among them.

verses.kjv: Blessed be the Lord, who daily loadeth us with benefits, even the God of our salvation. Selah.
verses.ct: Praise the Lord, who carries us through every day with his blessings — the God who saves us. Selah.

verses.kjv: He that is our God is the God of salvation; and unto GOD the Lord belong the issues from death.
verses.ct: Our God is a God who saves; the Lord GOD holds the power to rescue from death.

verses.kjv: But God shall wound the head of his enemies, and the hairy scalp of such an one as goeth on still in his trespasses.
verses.ct: But God will crush the heads of his enemies — the skulls of those who keep walking in their sins.

verses.kjv: The Lord said, I will bring again from Bashan, I will bring my people again from the depths of the sea:
verses.ct: The Lord said, "I will bring them back from Bashan. I will bring my people back from the depths of the sea,

verses.kjv: That thy foot may be dipped in the blood of thine enemies, and the tongue of thy dogs in the same.
verses.ct: so that your feet will wade through the blood of your enemies, and your dogs will get their share."

verses.kjv: They have seen thy goings, O God; even the goings of my God, my King, in the sanctuary.
verses.ct: They have witnessed your procession, God — the procession of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.

verses.kjv: The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; among them were the damsels playing with timbrels.
verses.ct: The singers led the way, the musicians followed behind, and in between were young women playing tambourines.

verses.kjv: Bless ye God in the congregations, even the Lord, from the fountain of Israel.
verses.ct: Praise God in the great assembly! Praise the Lord, all you who come from the source of Israel!

verses.kjv: There is little Benjamin with their ruler, the princes of Judah and their council, the princes of Zebulun, and the princes of Naphtali.
verses.ct: There is little Benjamin leading the way, the leaders of Judah with their throng, the leaders of Zebulun, and the leaders of Naphtali.

verses.kjv: Thy God hath commanded thy strength: strengthen, O God, that which thou hast wrought for us.
verses.ct: Your God has decreed your strength. Show your power, God — the power you have demonstrated for us.

verses.kjv: Because of thy temple at Jerusalem shall kings bring presents unto thee.
verses.ct: Because of your temple in Jerusalem, kings will bring their tribute to you.

verses.kjv: Rebuke the company of spearmen, the multitude of the bulls, with the calves of the people, till every one submit himself with pieces of silver: scatter thou the people that delight in war.
verses.ct: Rebuke the beast among the reeds, the herd of bulls among the nations' calves, until they bow down offering pieces of silver. Scatter the nations that love war.

verses.kjv: Princes shall come out of Egypt; Ethiopia shall soon stretch out her hands unto God.
verses.ct: Envoys will come from Egypt; Ethiopia will stretch out its hands to God in worship.

verses.kjv: Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth; O sing praises unto the Lord; Selah:
verses.ct: Sing to God, kingdoms of the earth! Make music to the Lord — Selah —

verses.kjv: To him that rideth upon the heavens of heavens, which were of old; lo, he doth send out his voice, and that a mighty voice.
verses.ct: to the one who rides across the ancient heavens. Listen — he thunders with his voice, a voice of tremendous power!

verses.kjv: Ascribe ye strength unto God: his excellency is over Israel, and his strength is in the clouds.
verses.ct: Declare that God is strong! His majesty shines over Israel, and his power fills the heavens.

verses.kjv: O God, thou art terrible out of thy holy places: the God of Israel is he that giveth strength and power unto his people. Blessed be God.
verses.ct: God, you are awe-inspiring from your holy places. The God of Israel gives strength and power to his people. Praise God!
